page.title: 08Types of Employment in Barby
page.content:
The results of a survey concerning the occupations of the parents of our school children revealed the following: 34% Listed housework as their main occupation and this was the largest category. The next two largest categories were electrical engineers and teachers at 6% each. Other job titles were bank clerk, accountant, photographer, engineer, reader in mathematics, secretary, sales manager, prison officer, driver, painter and decorator, farmer, barmaid, dressmaker, nurse, software support manager and catering executive.
The above information makes an interesting contrast with the occupations undertaken in Barby during 1874 when blacksmiths, tailors, wheel- righs, shoemakers and victuallers figured in this self sufficent village.
